urls.title: Wastewater is 'polluting rivers with microplastic'
urls.description: "Frequent releases" of sewage create microplastic hotspots in UK rivers.

text:
@ken_colwell For me the law is clear. Water companies should not be dumping sewage into our rivers at all "Save for exceptional circumstances".

That 20% reduction mentioned in that article would still mean discharges are illegal. Question is why are @DefraGovUK and @EnvAgency allowing it?
RT @SianieRoo: Silverdale & Knutson get it worse than anyone. It‚Äôs absolutely awful & the government need to put a stop to this now. So sor‚Ä¶

@FarmersOfTheUK River quality data coordinated by @EnvAgency SEPA, @NatResWales and published annually. Or river Poor due to diffuse ag pollution, many others ditto, eg Wye has deteriorated over past 10 yrs. Warnings 30 years ago ignored https://t.co/3ARJ3RvyPA
RT @scottdegg: @StinkStopthe @LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids Thank you Lucy you are amazing! #stopthestink
RT @iPMac: @LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW @LucyABeaumont this is our version of a #bluepeterbadge... a very exclusive #StopTheStink Cap... It‚Ä¶

@AngliaEnforceEA @EnvAgencyAnglia When evaluating your land and premises security kindly consider our mobile, monitored surveillance systems which provide an instant, effective deterrent against any criminal activity, at a very competitive rate, even where there is no power @WatchtowerSecu1 @PoliceCPI #Flytipping https://t.co/qgPJvng2bd

Wouldn't that be right @WaterUK, @DefraGovUK, @Ofwat, & @EnvAgency?
